Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: Using Pathfinder to play a courtly game of mystery and intrigue? Trying to wring pulpy action-adventure out of Call of Cthulhu? You're doing it wrong. Roleplaying games are technology and you might not be using yours right. Come see Adam Koebel (Dungeon World), Luke Crane (Burning Wheel, Torchbearer), and Sage LaTorra (Dungeon World) to learn how just wrong you are (and how to get right).
Event.name: You're Doing It Wrong: Finding the RPG You're Trying to Play

Event.description: Let us show you how you can turn your geeky hobbies into a career! -- Panelists: There are lots of people who boldly (or sometimes accidentally) strode out and made their part-time passion into a full-time career. Hear stories and tips from our panelists of photographers, seamstresses, video producers and more about how to change your passion to your livelihood.
Event.name: Level Up! Turning Your Geeky Hobbies Into Geeky Careers

Event.description: Tearaway is a game about a little messenger in a papery world held entirely in your hands, with a fourth wall breaking design that makes you as much a part of the story as your little messenger friend. Learn how we designed and built a realistic paper world that flexes, folds, tears and crumples at your very touch, how paper influenced every part of the game’s construction from the art style, to the sound effects, music and UI, and what’s next for the world of Tearaway. -- Panelists: James Spafford [Community Manger, Media Molecule]
Event.name: How Media Molecule Made the Fourth-Wall-Breaking Papery World of Tearaway

Event.description: Firewatch is a video game being made by Campo Santo, a new ten-person independent team based in San Francisco. It's a moody, first-person wilderness mystery with lots of dialogue, planned for release in 2015. -- Panelists: Join us for the public unveiling of the game, including the first gameplay demonstration as well as the debut of the teaser trailer. Several members of the team will be present to talk through gameplay, respond to questions, and probably accidentally break an NDA or two.
Event.name: Making Firewatch: Trailer and a First Look from Campo Santo

Event.description: Join the Halo Developers from 343 Industries for an in-depth look into Halo: The Master Chief Collection and other upcoming Halo projects and releases. Come celebrate The Master Chief and the future of the franchise as we take you on the next steps of your Halo journey. -- Panelists: Dan Ayoub [Executive Producer, 343 Industries], Frank O'connor [Franchise Director, 343 Industries], Kiki Wolfkill [Partner Executive Producer, 343 Industries]
Event.name: Halo and the Journey of The Master Chief

Event.description: The return of the wildly popular panel from PAX East! A live game show that asks and answers questions about being transgender and involved in gaming. Using a format similar to Cards Against Humanity, our panelists find fun answers then poll the audience as to which answers seem right or wrong, and why. Audience members can pose their own questions or try their hand at providing an answer for a unique Q&A. -- Panelists: Eric L. Patterson [Executive Editor, EGM], Jennell Jaquays [Chief Creative Officer, Olde Skuul], Rebecca Heineman [Founder, Olde Skuul], Caspian Priebe [Concept Artist, Crooked Tree Studios], Gwyneth Yeh [Environmental Artist, ArenaNet]
Event.name: Press XY Presents: Trans Against Insanity - HD Edition

Event.description: Giving players an opportunity to be involved in the development of the narrative of a world gives them a sense of engagement like nothing else. From dialogue trees, karma meters, and multiple endings, to open-ended systems where the players write their own story, to truly interactive settings where player actions drive the plot itself, giving players power over the narrative gives them agency. What techniques can help players and designers craft narrative together? And is it all worth the costs? -- Panelists: Fred Wan [L5R Assistant Story Lead, Alderac Entertainment Group], James Portnow [Writer, Extra Credits], Tom Abernathy [Lead Writer, Riot Games]
Event.name: Player Driven Narratives: Players as Storytellers

Event.description: You know they can make a JPEG, but did you know they can also sign stuff? Their talents are almost limitless! Come, see Gabe and Tycho do things with your own eyeballs.
Event.name: Autograph Session: Gabe and Tycho

Event.description: How do I get into tabletop gaming? How do I talk about board games I like? How about the ones I hate? How do I find more I want to play? How do I avoid those that would waste my time? How do I preserve my hard earned dollars? Join this expert panel as they get into the details you need and want to know about board games – from how to talk like a board game enthusiast to criticize them and find a critic you like. -- Panelists: Jon Bolding [Tabletop Editor, The Escapist], Justin Achilli [Designer, Vampire: The Masquerade, White Wolf], Ryan LaFlamme [Tabletop Critic, The Cardboard Republic], Tom Lommel [Founder, The Dungeon Bastard], Joshua Vanderwall [Managing Editor, The Escapist], Luke Crane [Community Manager for Games, Kickstarter]
Event.name: How to Love and Hate Tabletop Games

Event.description: This panel of cosplay master builders will discuss building your next epic cosplay costume from beginning to end. We'll take your dream from concept to reality covering patterns and design, selecting the right materials, construction techniques, how to finish them, and all the tips and tricks you'll need along the way. -- Panelists: Brian Morris [Master Builder, Owner, Zaklabs], Ryan Wells [Wells Productions], Jade Cheung [Master Builder, Owner, Arctic Phoenix Studios], Mary Mann [Master Seamstress, Mann and Cloth]
Event.name: Building Your EPIC Cosplay Costume from A to Z

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: Come meet some dudes on the internet. What makes these specific dudes so special? No idea, but maybe we can find out together at this shameless marketing stunt they like to call a "panel". Live QA and possible gameplay or special video if you're good.
Event.name: Get All Up Inside Gaming

Event.description: The role of music in gaming has evolved as much as the medium itself. From 8 bit music to Rock Band, music has moved from the background into the forefront and “Disney Fantasia: Music Evolved” takes this process to the next level. Get a behind-the-scenes look at what it takes to produce music for the first-ever immersive music discovery platform that allows players to perform, conduct and remix some of the most classic music of the modern era, creating a truly unique sound. -- Panelists: Emily Reese [Host/Producer, Classical MPR], Inon Zur [Award-winning Compser, Inon Zur, Inc.], Eddie Kramer [Recording Producer and Engineer, Remark Music, Ltd], Gwen Bethel Riley [Head of Business Affairs, Music, Disney Interactive], Christopher Nicholls [Executive Producer, Disney Interactive]
Event.name: Music Evolved – From 8 Bit Soundtrack to Gameplay

Event.description: In February 2014, thousands of gamers worked together to beat Pokemon Red, each inputting one command at a time into a Twitch livestream chat. It took them 16 days, and in this panel, game researcher Alex Leavitt will show you how TwitchPlaysPokemon happened, as well as the phenomenon it spawned. We have the chats, the reddit threads, and the fan art. Come learn about what TPP can tell us about livestreaming, the Internet hivemind, late '90s nostalgia, and the future of gaming culture. -- Panelists: Alex Leavitt [Researcher & PhD Candidate, Annenberg School for Communication, University of Southern California]
Event.name: TwitchPlayedPokemon: A Postmortem for a Cultural Phenomenon

Event.description: Come see the developers from Firaxis Games Studio as they provide an inside look at their new and upcoming title, Sid Meier’s Civilization: Beyond Earth, before it ships this October 24, 2014! We’ll be showing new gameplay, talking about some of the newer and late-game features, as well as discussing the challenges and opportunities that arose throughout the development process. -- Panelists: Firaxis Development Team
Event.name: Firaxis Games Mega Panel

Event.description: The most addictive and hardest-hitting convention game show returns! Just being in the audience enters you to possibly compete and go head-to-head against The Thrown Controllers crew. Train your trivia knowledge and your hand dexterity and pray you don't draw a Brutal Question. Awesome prizes to whoever gets the highest score! -- Panelists: ProtoJon, ChuggaConroy, NintendoCapriSun
Event.name: Polaris Presents: Thrown Controllers

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: The hugely popular "faux-wards" show returns to highlight the best female game characters of 2014. Industry vets duke it out with audience votes to determine the leading ladies of such categories as "Best Princess," "Best Woman in an FPS," and—everyone's favorite—"Best Woman in a Refrigerator." Come debate with the pros for a chance to support your favorite female characters in video games.
Event.name: Top Women Game Characters of All Time

Event.description: Your pick didn't make it to Round 3? Even after we gave you that do over? Seriously? Were you not observing how each Omeganaut would handle falling in a tower over and over? Ok, TRY AGAIN, and take the information you learned from Round 2 and throw it in the garbage, because Super Avalanche 2 is pretty much the exact opposite of falling. A favorite in the PA offices, it was only a matter of time before this PAX 10 winner showed up in the Omegathon.
Event.name: Omegathon Round 3: Super Avalanche 2

Event.description: Want to hear about some new exclusives and surprises coming to Orcs Must Die! Unchained from Robot Entertainment? You don’t want to miss this panel! Robot Entertainment is hosting their first PAX Prime panel and we are going to be chatting with fans about everything. Hear stories about the Ensemble Studio days and the Age of Empires series, learn about new exclusive news and surprises for Orcs Must Die! Unchained and don’t miss out on all the amazing giveaways we have planned for our fans. Help start this new tradition for Robot at PAX and spend your Saturday afternoon with us! Oh—did we mention all the free prizes?!? -- Panelists: Patrick Hudson [CEO, Robot Entertainment], Justin Korthof [Community Entertainment, Robot Entertainment], Lance Hoke [Producer, Robot Entertainment], Ian Fischer [Design Director, Robot Entertainment], Chris Moffitt [Art Director, Robot Entertainment]
Event.name: Orcs Must Die! - An Afternoon of Fun with Robot Entertainment

Event.description: Do swords and armor really work like Game of Thrones? Do Call of Duty and Battlefield get guns right? It seems like the more details movies, TV, and games show us, the more they contradict each other—and, typically, the less they get right. Presented by industry-recognized instructors and combat veterans, Combat Q&A answers common questions and dispels prolific myths frequently perpetuated about firearms, ancient weaponry, tactics, military equipment, and the physiological effects of violence. -- Panelists: Greg Spyridis [President, Game Monkey Press], Matthew Wagner [SSgt, US Army Rangers (ret)], Mark Rosen [Captain, US Army (ret)], John Barnett [Sgt, US Army (ret)]
Event.name: Combat Q&A

Event.description: "YouTube Creator" has become a viable career option for anyone with a passion and a camera. Learn the steps, skills and resources needed to get a start on YouTube and become a successful voice in the video game industry. ScrewAttack's Craig Skistimas moderates this panel of top game-centric YouTube personalities to reveal what it takes to run a YouTube channel full-time, while Fullscreen VP of Talent Operations Phil Ranta gives tips on becoming the next YouTube star. -- Panelists: Craig Skistimas [General Manager, ScrewAttack], Phil Ranta [VP of Talent Operations, Fullscreen], Graham Stark [LoadingReadyRun], Melonie Mac [Melonie86], Andrew Gonzales [FireRockerzStudios]
Event.name: So You Want to Be a YouTuber?

Event.description: We believe the pursuit of mastery is one of the key reasons why players continue to connect with and play League of Legends years after the game's launch. To create a viable "path to mastery," game systems have to be deep enough to provide opportunities for players to demonstrate personal expertise, teamwork, and adaptability. Game designers from Riot will share stories of our notable wins and spectacular fails as we strive to create a deep, endlessly engaging experience for players. -- Panelists: Greg Street [Lead Game Designer, Riot Games], Jeevun Sidhu [Associate Technical Designer, Riot Games], Brian Feeney [Associate Champion Designer, Riot Games], Jordan Anton [Associate Champion Designer, Riot Games], Mark Yetter [Game Designer, Riot Games]
Event.name: Deep Dive Into Design Depth in League of Legends

Event.description: Video games are improving the lives of people around the world. They are being integrated into healthcare settings to improve treatment outcomes and patient care. They are being deployed to soldiers overseas to improve morale. Even that candy game on your mobile device has the capability to crush depression. This panel will focus on the impact that gamers are having on the world around them and how they are making it a better place. -- Panelists: Kelli N. Dunlap [Psy.D., American School of Professional Psychology], Zach Wigal [Founder, Gamers Outreach], Jamie Dillion [Project Manager, Child's Play Charity, Penny Arcade], Jean-Jacques Mott [Children's Hospital]
Event.name: Giving Through Gaming: Making the World a Better Place

Event.description: You've been invited to help design a games journalism simulator, a majestic open-world universe featuring Doritos-stained keyboards and fantastic bribes for reviewing games. This satirical panel, featuring game press veterans, invites the audience to participate in the faux-design meeting, allowing for honest and humorous discussion about some of game journalism's most persistent myths. -- Panelists: Xav de Matos [Feature Content Director, Joystiq], Jeff Green [Consultant, Hit Detection], Jeff Cannata [Host, DLC Podcast], Mitch Dyer [Editor, IGN], Evan [Reporter, Kotaku], Alexa Ray Corriera [Reporter, Polygon]
Event.name: Help Design Game Journalism Story!

Event.description: If the names ProtonJon, NintendoCapriSun, and Chuggaaconroy mean anything to you, you may be interested in meeting them and getting some stuff signed. If not, go away you filthy swine.
Event.name: Autograph Session: The Runaway Guys

Event.description: It’s been a huge year for D&D, but there’s still room for more! Nathan Stewart, Brand Director for Dungeons & Dragons, will lead a panel of game developers in a discussion highlighting some new D&D games coming down the pipeline. Join us as we take a look at the future, revealing the different ways you’ll be able to experience Dungeons & Dragons!
Event.name: Videogames in the Forgotten Realms: A Sneak Peek at D&D's Line-up for 2015

Event.description: This panel, led by some of the community facing staff at Twitch, focuses on how to grow your Twitch community as a new broadcaster as well as how current broadcasters can expand their current communities into new ones. -- Panelists: This panel is open to partners, broadcasters, fans and viewers. There's swag too!
Event.name: How to Build Your Twitch Community

Event.description: A great Dungeon Master is part referee, part storyteller, and part actor. The art of the Dungeon Master is in combining all of these talents to become a superhuman, D&D-propelling package. Join the Dungeons & Dragons team as they discuss various tips and tricks to bring the best adventure to your players, as well as ways to make them equal participants in the story. A Q&A session will follow the panel discussion, wherein the team can address questions about the new edition of D&D. -- Panelists: Greg BIlsland [D&D Senior Producer, Wizards of the Coast LLC], Chris Perkins [D&D Story and World-Building Lead, Wizards of the Coast LLC], Mike Mearls [D&D Senior Manager, Wizards of the Coast LLC]
Event.name: Art of the Dungeon Master

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: For 10 years the Angry Video Game Nerd has been taking you back to the past on YouTube and Cinemassacre.com to review the worst games of all time. The fan-funded feature film is out! What is next for the nerd? Join James Rolfe, The Angry Video Game Nerd and find out. Ask your burning questions about the movie, the show, and anything in between.
Event.name: The Angry Video Game Nerd Panel

Event.description: His signature is actually available on Wikipedia, but whatever, I guess there's value in meeting the guy. Is the Name of the Wind actually named after you? Only one way to find out – incessantly pester the creator of the amazing book!
Event.name: Autograph Session: Patrick Rothfuss

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: Case Modding is where hardware and video game enthusiasts modify a computer or console case to show off the components, improve hardware performance, and redesign the look and theme of the case. Join a panel of modding pros as they talk about their cases, methods, worklogs, techniques, water cooling, tools and about how you can collaborate with your friends to make cool mods! After the panel, the moderator will give a walking tour and talk about some of the mods displayed on the Exhibition Floor.
Event.name: Case Modders: Creating Faster, Colder, and Cooler Gaming Computers

Event.description: Developers on Kickstarter need backers to fund their games, but what happens after the money comes in and the developers get back to work? We talk to a panel of developers who have run successful Kickstarters about how they handle development with thousands of stakeholders. Learn how to use the pressure and feedback to make a better game without it being overwhelming, and about what backers can do to help. -- Panelists: Matt Gilgenbach [President, Infinitap Games], Ryan Dancey [CEO, Goblinworks], Nate Downes [President, Missing Worlds Media], Lat Ware [Founder, Crooked Tree Studios], Colin Sullivan [Attorney, CrowdCounsel]
Event.name: It's Complicated: Developers' Relationship with Backers

Event.description: For the 10th year in a row, it’s Major Nelson Radio at PAX Prime! Like a fine wine that has gotten better with age, Major Nelson Radio goes down smooth and leaves no bitter aftertaste.
Event.name: Major Nelson Radio at PAX Prime

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: Triple-A action games have to deliver on two fronts: gameplay has to be fresh and satisfying, but the experience also has to be visceral and visually striking. This panel will take you behind the scenes to show how the most memorable and intense moments of game combat are created. Join panelists from Naughty Dog, Sucker Punch, and Respawn, as they pull back the curtain on the techniques, tricks, and details that create these uniquely intense experiences.
Event.name: AAA Combat: Behind the Scenes

Event.description: In 1998 Tim Schafer released Grim Fandango, his final game at Lucas Arts before leaving to start Double Fine Productions. The game saw great critical success and has gone on to be considered one of the great classics. Now, over 15 years later, the game is being re-released as Grim Fandango Remastered debuting on PlayStation 4 & Vita. Join a panel consisting of both the game's original creators and the team responsible for the new release as they discuss the game's original development, their feelings on the game looking back, and how they are approaching development on the new release! -- Panelists: Tim Schafer [President & CEO, Double Fine Productions], Peter Chan [Concept Artist and Illustrator], Peter McConnell [Composer, Little Big Note Music], Brandon Dillon [Senior Programmer, Double Fine Productions]
Event.name: Grim Fandango: Bringing the Dead Back to Life

Event.description: We are a community born from creativity and the experience of being different. Many of us carry the painful memories of being rejected by our peers, seeking refuge in our games and wanting to connect to others like us. So how is it that bullying and harassment have become so commonplace? And what power do we really have to change anything? Join us as we explore the experience of bullying & its real life effects, reflect on the research, and open the space for our voices and stories to be heard. -- Panelists: Stacey Weber [Psychotherapist / Gamer, Face the Sea, LLP], Joshua Neal [Clinician / Gamer, Sound Mental Health], Megan Spurr [Managing Editor, Dorkadia.com]
Event.name: Not Us, Not Here: Examining Bullying, Harassment & Misogyny

Event.description: Meet the creator of Mega Man and more recently Mighty No. 9 and Gunvolt. A talented industry legend making time to sign things for you? We should all be so lucky!
Event.name: Autograph Session: Keiji Inafune

Event.description: Joint Extra Credits and Friends for an evening of questions, answers, new show reveals, the long promised voice acting episode (this is almost certainly a lie), and general reveling. -- Panelists: There will be badgers…
Event.name: Extra Credits

Event.description: Statistically speaking, you or someone you love will have a disability in your lifetime. Imagine your life without gaming. Find out what industry leaders like Mark Barlet are doing to ensure everyone can game, no the matter the disability. -- Panelists: Mark Barlet [Founder, AbleGamers], Craig Kaufman [Principal Events Coordinator, AbleGamers], Troy Hewitt [Senior Community Manager, Motiga], Keith Knight [Professional League of Legends Gamer with Disabilities], Linda Carlson [Director of Global Relations, Sony Online Entertainment], Lindsay Miller [Leading User Tests Expert, Behemoth]
Event.name: Why Gaming with a Disability Should Matter to You

Event.description: What does it take to write music for games? Hear from five of the industry's most accomplished composers as they share their experiences and discuss the craft of scoring music for some of the most popular titles in interactive entertainment. Featuring the award-winning composers of Assassin's Creed, Bastion, Borderlands, Dead Rising, Destiny, Halo, Hitman, Mass Effect, Ratchet & Clank, State of Decay, Sunset Overdrive, Transistor, and many more! -- Panelists: Martin O'Donnell [Composer], Jesper Kyd [Composer], Darren Korb [Composer, SuperGiant], Boris Salchow [Composer], Sascha Dikiciyan [Composer], Oleksa Lozowchuk [Composer/Producer, Capcom]
Event.name: Maestros of Videogames

Event.description: EEDAR co-founder Geoffrey Zatkin presents a tour de force romp through video game industry data, patterns and trends, covering everything from next generation consoles to the maturation of mobile games to how review scores anchor your perception and everything in-between. Guaranteed to raise your game industry IQ. -- Panelists: Attendees will gain a better understanding of recent macro and micro trends of the video game industry - not anecdotal, but trends based on actual objectively quantifiable data. A broad range of timely industry topics will be presented.
Event.name: Awesome Video Game Data

Event.description: While Hearthstone may be new to the scene that was originally established by Magic: the Gathering, both games have a lot to learn from each other, as well as a lot to offer for the long-term success of both. The easy access of Hearthstone is perfect for lounging at home, and the interactions you have with other players during a game of paper Magic brings players to their local hobby shop by the drove. How will the existence of the two at-odds games impact the community of card game players? -- Panelists: Joshua Vanderwall [Managing Editor, The Escapist], Nikolaus Davidson [Advanced Game Designer, Wizards of the Coast], Brian Kibler [Senior Designer, Stoneblade Entertainment], Jonathan Bolding [Senior Editor-Tabletop, The Escapist]
Event.name: Building for Synergy – Symbiosis of Hearthstone and Magic

Event.description: You might know them for their animations, their life-guides, their magnificent editing, or a little musical group known as Starbomb, but they are collectively known as The Game Grumps. Join the group for a Q&A about everything Grumps, Starbomb, Table Flip, Steam Train, and why Barry always wins. -- Panelists: Egoraptor [Polaris], Danny Sexbang, RubberRoss, Mortem3r, Barry
Event.name: Polaris Presents: Game Grumps

Event.description: A key factor in creating a memorable game is creating a memorable world for your characters to interact in and with, from creatures and culture to the very land the characters stand on. Join Claire Hummel (production designer at HBO), Lexxy Douglass (of Strip Search and The Cloud Factory), and Abby Howard (of Strip Search and The Last Halloween) in this conversation on the do's and don'ts of building unique and interesting worlds for video games, comic books, or any medium! -- Panelists: Claire Hummel [Production Designer, HBO], Lexxy Douglass [Artist, Motiga], Abby Howard [Abby Howard Comics]
Event.name: Costumes, Castles and Creatures: World Design in Video Games

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: It feels like video games have been around for ages, but in truth they're still a relatively young medium. In the last few years we've witnessed them beginning to take on more serious subjects and mature themes in their narrative. Is this the start of the adulthood of storytelling in games? Join our all-star panel of game writers and narrative experts as we discuss this exciting new direction in game narrative and speculate on a bold new future of interactive storytelling.
Event.name: You're SO mature! Is storytelling in games coming of age?

Event.description: The Big F: Feminism. Lady developers, community managers, and journalists discuss the role of women in the video games industry including the triumphs and trials they've faced, and what we can all do to make the community a better place. -- Panelists: Alexa Ray Corriea [Reporter, Polygon], Brianna Wu [Head of Development, Giant Spacekat], Susan Arendt [Managing Editor, Joystiq], Andrea Rene Ehnert [GameTrailers, Senior Producer], Stephanie Bayer [Community Manager, Insomniac Games], Tifa Robles [Founder, Organizer, The Lady Planeswalkers Society]
Event.name: The "F" Word

Event.description: Really? All whammies for you again? My goodness, are you TRYING to pick those that don't get through? I mean, if that's the case, slow clap for you, because the odds were really stacked against you there. Focus now. Just close your eyes and clear your mind. Go to your happy place. Who's the first Omeganaut you think of? Bam, you have a 50/50 shot. So, Johann Sebastion Joust! J.S. Joust is a game that is silly and hilarious and like a rare flower is an Omegathon game that requires some athleticism. Good luck to our remaining combatants!
Event.name: Omegathon Round 4: J.S. Joust

Event.description: Join the composers of some of your favorite games for an autograph session taking place immediately after their panel. Sounds like fun (get it?).
Event.name: Autograph Session: Maestros of Gaming

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: Put your chainsaws in the air - Kris Straub (Chainsawsuit, Broodhollow, D&D Intro Animations) and Mikey Neumann (Borderlands, the voice of Scooter, The Returners) record their LIVE comedy talk podcast LIVE in front of a living PAX audience. If you like laughing, you will not want to miss this. If you hate laughing, bring a pack of Twizzlers and crinkle the wrapper very rudely.
Event.name: Chainsawsuit Live

Event.description: The Video Game Music Trivia that kicked your butt last year is BACK with more creative categories, more obscure songs, and more chances to win! With over a hundred song samples coming from the arcade to the Xbox (and everywhere in between), your knowledge of video game music will be put to the test! So you think you know video game tunes? Join us for your shot to be one of the lucky participants randomly selected to fight for the title of Video Game Music Trivia Champion of PAX Prime 2014! -- Panelists: Phoebe Johnson [Trivia Ambassador, VGMT], Austin Riedhammer [Tech Ops, VGMT]
Event.name: Video Game Music Trivia

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: Tired of getting crushed, killed, smoked, chopped, and screwed in today's hottest multiplayer games? The expert competitors of Giant Bomb Dot Com are here to help! Stick around as we teach you techniques that will work in any eSports video game, including hot openers like "The Caravella Gambit" and "Shoemaker's Lament." After that, throws are encouraged and headshots are also welcome as we show you game-ending strats like "Gerstmann's Folly" and "The Klepek Krunch." eSports!
Event.name: The Giant Bomb Guide to eSports Victory!

Event.description: After PAX East, our heroes were in quite a predicament. Two green dragons had a
Event.name: Live D&D with Acquisitions Inc. - Five Heads are Better than None

Event.description: Many have tried to cheer up the crew behind Game Grumps, and many have failed. Will you be up to the task? If you fail, the consolation prize is an autograph…so…it's still kind of a win/win.
Event.name: Autograph Session: Game Grumps

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: The super awesome geeky improv group is at it again! Come check out an hour of wonderful improvised scenes that will never be seen again! Based on your suggestions, these rogue-ish types will creates scenes with the result being maximum hilarity.
Event.name: The Improv Initiative: The Re-Improvining

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: Come look behind the scenes of the three year long process of independent filmmaking that brought "Video Games: The Movie" to life. See behind the scenes clips featuring Sean Astin, Zach Braff, Wil Wheaton as well as many game industry icons like Nolan Bushnell, Cliff Bleszinski, David Perry and more. Director Jeremy Snead hosts a variety of people from the film as they discuss not only the independent spirit that made the film possible, but where the game industry is headed in the future.
Event.name: Video Games: The Movie (Making of The Film)

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: Join the AppJunkies as they highlight the best of the worst games straight from the seedy side of the app store. It's an entirely new lineup of horrible app disasters, so prepare to be amazed (and slightly stunned) at this fast-paced journey through the Land of Absurdity. It's MST3K meets ridiculous gaming neatly wrapped and delivered in an hour of your life you won't get back. Audience heckling encouraged… at least for those not rendered speechless.
Event.name: AppJunkies Live: The Worst Games Ever Made!

Event.description: Game collecting is taking off in a big way, and all sorts of classic games and related memorabilia can bring in big bucks. What's your gaming treasure worth? Bring something you found in your parents' attic or a rarity from your own collection, and you'll have a chance to come up on stage and have your stuff evaluated, discussed and appraised (amateurishly, for fun!) by our panel of experts. Chris Kohler, an editor at WIRED and the author of RETRO magazine's column on game collecting, moderates. -- Panelists: Chris Kohler [Editor, WIRED]
Event.name: Retrogame Roadshow: What Are Your Old Games Worth?

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: "The Smash Brothers" documentary took the gaming and eSports world by surprise in 2013 - for the first time many learned about the passionate, deep history of the Smash Brothers community. Where did it all start? How did this grassroots community become one of the most powerful voices in gaming? What does the future have in store? Learn about the history and development of the community from it's key players. Interested in becoming a Smasher? We'll also let you know how to get involved.
Event.name: The Smash Brothers Community - Past, Present, and Future
